intro: Phacelia marshall-johnstonii var. deliciasana, commonly known as Delicias phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
